verse.name: c1a
verse.lines:
I’ve got a mansion
just over the hilltop,

In that bright land
where we’ll never grow old.

verse.name: c1b
verse.lines:
And some day yonder
We will never more wander,

But walk on streets
that are purest gold.

verse.name: v1a
verse.lines:
I’m satisfied with
just a cottage below…

a little silver,
and a little gold.

verse.name: v1b
verse.lines:
But in that city,
where the ransomed will shine…

I want a gold one
that’s silver lined.

verse.name: v2a
verse.lines: Tho’ often tempted, tormented and tested

And like the prophet,
my pillow a stone,

verse.name: v2b
verse.lines:
And tho I find here,
No permanent dwelling,

I know He’ll give me
a mansion my own.

verse.name: v3a
verse.lines: Don’t think me poor or, deserted or lonely.

I’m not discouraged,
I’m heaven bound.

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines:
I’m just a pilgrim
in search of that city...

I want a mansion,
a harp and a crown.
